instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928-A
threads.message:
Hi guys. 

I have this A1707 with no power stuck at 20V 0amps. No liquid damage. The ISL9239(U7000) was heating up a bit and I replaced it, one contact under it was gone, Pin 36 TBA_GATE_Q1. Also, I have replaced U3200 cause it was heating up. Now I have the same state no power 20v. I noticed that PPBUS_G3H is not going up and stays at 0.8v up to 1v variation, and there's no short measurement with diode mode. U4200 had some dust and looks funny on the edges it peeled off. The strange thing that I found on the board
it's a component under R4308 which is not on the board view, but I'm guessing on the schematics it's XW4300 and it should be going to ground.  

Any suggestions would be appreciated, thank you 🙏

 [ATTACH type="full" width="319px" alt="A1707 ISL"]61265[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-00928-A
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H?

Remove F7000/1 and check C7050 voltage.
Check/replace Q7030/40.

threads.title: 820-00928-A
threads.message: I replaced Q7030 now powers on, thank you very much  🙏 :cool:

threads.title: 820-00928-A
threads.message: I suspected Q7030 because the Gate of high-side MOSFET was left on air.
